Ingredients.3: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, or more as desired

Ingredients.5: 1 (10 ounce) bag baby spinach leaves, chopped

Ingredients.7: 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans (chickpeas), rinsed and drained

Ingredients.8: 1 teaspoon chopped fresh marjoram, or more to taste

Ingredients.9: 1 freshly ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.10: 0.5 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.11: 0.25 cup freshly grated Pecorino-Romano cheese, or to taste

Directions.1: Bring a large pot of water with 2 teaspoons sea salt to a boil. Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of water.

Directions.2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute. Increase the heat to medium-high and add spinach, tomatoes, and garbanzo beans; cook and stir until spinach begins to wilt, 1 to 2 minutes more.

Directions.3: Season the spinach mixture with remaining teaspoon sea salt, marjoram, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Reduce heat to low. Stir drained linguine with the spinach mixture to evenly coat. Add extra olive oil or reserved pasta water to achieve preferred level of moisture in the dish. Top with Pecorino Romano cheese.
